title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Thursday 16 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: body found by barrow railway is missing man .
driver arrested after woman dies in crash .
christmas lights go on as councils find the money .

documents.title: through the day : bbc cumbria live
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports and a regular weather forecast , for today .
here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it all again from 08:00 tomorrow .
if there 's news you think we should know or you want to share a photo you 've taken in the county , let us know by sending an email , on facebook or on twitter .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: watch : grittters load up for cold night
text: county highways engineers watch a network of sensors and detailed weather forecasts to decide when and where to spread rocksalt on the county 's roads .
we 're gritting 12 priority routes mainly in south and west # cumbria .
full details : colder night ahead with road temperatures forecast to fall below zero in some places .
risk of # frost and # ice # planahead # staysafe

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : clear and cold
text: it will be a clear and cold night across cumbria with northwesterly winds and a widespread frost forming inland through the small hours of friday .
temperatures will fall to about 3c ( 37f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: memorabilia shell sparked auctioneer alert
text: this is the world war one dummy shell which sparked an alert at an auctioneer 's office in carlisle this morning .

it was delivered with other memorabilia to the auction house on the brough road industrial estate for valuation , and fearing it might be live , workers called the emergency services , who contacted the army 's explosive ordnance disposal team for advice .
their judgement was that the shell was used for training and was not explosive .

documents.title: girl asked if we wanted sex , says boy in rape trial
text: one of four boys accused of raping a 15-year-old girl in workington told police the following day that she approached them , and initiated sex , carlisle crown court has been told today .
the four boys all deny charges of rape and sexual assault last january .
the can not be named because of their ages .
earlier the court was told how another teenage boy , who knew the victim , had gone looking for her with friends when she was reported missing .
they found her in the field , caked with mud and crying hysterically , saying she had been raped .
the trial continues .

documents.title: police pay rise 'pushes cumbria force into the red '
text: cumbria 's police commissioner peter mccall says the extra pay rise given to police earlier this year means he is spending almost £ 1m over his budget .

police have had only a 1 % rise for a number of years because of public spending restraints , but this year the government awarded a 1 % bonus as well , and mr mccall said he was now heading for a £ 925,000 overspend by april 2018 .
mr mccall said he and the police were examining how to balance the budget with the extra costs half way through the financial year .
he said the government should have provided extra money to cover the bonus pay , and he 'd raised the issues with the police minister nick hurd .
i am determined to maintain our policing presence in the county , and will consider all contingencies to deliver this . ''

documents.title: city shopping centre appeals against shutters decision
text: the lanes shopping centre in carlisle is appealing against a decision which prevents it blocking off entrances with shutters overnight .
in august , city councillors rejected an application for shutters to be used .
the commercial director , david jackson , said the centre was trying to stop anti-social behaviour and criminal damage .

documents.title: councillors vote to limit allowance increase
text: cumbria county councillors have voted to give themselves a pay rise from next april .

councillors at a meeting in kendal saw a report from an independent panel , saying the basic allowance should rise by 1 % to £ 8,405 , with a 2 % increase for those with more time-consuming responsibilities .
but councillors agreed that all members should have a 1 % increase , whatever their responsibilities , and that in future allowances will be linked to any pay rises for council staff .
the increases will add £ 11,000 a year to the cost of the allowance scheme .

documents.title: police find body near barrow station
text: police say the body of a man has been found near railway lines next to greengate street in barrow .
he has not yet been formally identified and police say that as yet the cause of death is unconfirmed .
barrow station has been closed while police investigations continue .

documents.title: travel : incident halts rail services into barrow
text: barrow station has been closed , with replacement bus services running to ulverston .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : crash near airport blocks a689
text: a crash involving a car and a lorry has blocked the a689 near the airport junction just outside carlisle .
cumbria police are urging people to avoid the area .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: curle gives 75-minute dressing down after 7-0 hammering
text: a carlisle united side featuring several first team squad members were kept in the dressing room for over an hour by manager keith curle following their 7-0 defeat at fleetwood town yesterday in the central league cup .
samir nabi , john o'sullivan , sam cosgrove and steven rigg all started the game along with three trialists .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: beds campaigner says community nursing 'going well '
text: one campaigner fighting to keep hospital in-patient beds in alston says the community nursing system that is likely to replace them has supported people in the remote pennine town who might otherwise have had to go to hospital in carlisle .
alix martin was speaking on the day the issues will be raised at a county council meeting .

beds have been temporarily closed at alston for months because of staff shortages , and formal moves are being made to replace them completely there , and in wigton and maryport , with care in the community .
ms martin said community nurses had been given more training and they were now able to deal with much more complex cases .

there have been quite a number of occasions where they have been able to support somebody here in alston where previously the thing would 've been too complicated to stay in the [ cottage ] hospital and they would have had to go to the acute hospital . ''

documents.title: west coast train staff vote for strike
text: train staff belonging to the rmt union on virgin west coast have voted 9-1 to take action , including strike action , to try to get in increase equalling a £ 500 pay offer to drivers .
the union said nearly 1,800 workers including train managers and on-board catering workers on the west coast route from glasgow to euston took part in the vote
a virgin trains spokesman said they hoped to be able to run most services throughout any industrial action .
`` we have offered a 3.2 % annual pay increase at a time when the average increase across public and private sector employees is around 2 % .
we remain open to continuing talks with the rmt '' , he said .

documents.title: carlisle wine store 'hopes for no scottish booze rush '
text: one wine merchant with a store in carlisle says he hopes a flood of scottish customers trying to dodge the new minimum price for alcohol can be avoided .
earlier this week the uk supreme court ruled that scotland can set a minimum price for alcohol .
rowan gormley , chief executive of majestic wines , said he was hoping the system would be extended to england .
`` we support minimum pricing on alcohol rather than duty increases as this tackles the true issue of binge drinking cheap alcohol , not punishing those who enjoy alcohol responsibly , '' he said .
dumfriesshire conservative msp oliver mundell claimed many people already did their shopping in carlisle and took advantage of promotional offers on alcohol not available in scotland .

documents.title: 'shell ' turns out to be a dummy
text: an item thought to be a world war one shell , which was found in carlisle , has been identified as a dummy by explosive ordnance experts .
it 's understood to have been among property brought into an auction house .
the emergency services have now stood down .

documents.title: police post photo after burglary haul goes on sale
text: police have published a cctv of a man they want to trace after items stolen in a high-value burglary ended up for sale in a carlisle second-hand shop .
goods including a dashcam , a hedge-trimmer and fishing gear worth more than £ 1,000 were taken from a shed in dowbeck road in the city earlier this year .
police investigating the theft say some of the items ended up in cash generator in carlisle .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : sunny , with a chilly breeze
text: it should be mostly dry and bright this afternoon with plenty of sunny spells .
it will feel quite chilly in a strengthening breeze , with temperatures this afternoon of 12c ( 54f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: bomb squad called after old shell is found
text: parts of an industrial estate in carlisle have been cleared after what is thought to be a world war one shell was found .
firefighters and police were called at about 10:40 after the item , about 2ft long , was discovered on wasteland near marconi road .
the emergency services are now awaiting the arrival of an explosives disposal team .

documents.title: rape trial told how friends searched for attackers
text: a teenage boy has told a jury at carlisle crown court that he found a 15-year-old girl lying in a muddy field in workington claiming she 'd been raped and went looking for her assailants .
four youths under 16 have denied two charges each of raping the girl , and a third of another sexual assault .
the witness told the jury he and his friends spent an hour-and-a-half searching for a group of boys he believed responsible .
the trial at carlisle crown court is scheduled for two weeks .
author: Adam Powell
Journalist, BBC Radio Cumbria

documents.title: united 's adams to have knee surgery
text: carlisle midfielder nicky adams has been told he faces surgery on his knee for a cruciate ligament injury , and between six and eight months off the field .
the play suffered a dislocated knee in the match against yeovil at the weekend .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: sedbergh fire victim is named
text: cumbria 's coroner has confirmed the woman who died following a fire at her home in sedbergh at the weekend was marjorie harper , who was 85 .
mrs harper died at wythenshawe hospitals 's burns unit , where she was flown after fire crews rescued her from her home in bainbridge road .
an inquest will be held in due course .

documents.title: county peer questions cottage hospital bed plans
text: the views of a cumbrian peer who has expressed `` grave '' concerns about hospital bed closures will be discussed by county councillors later today .
labour 's lord liddle , who is also a county councillor , is questioning plans formally to close in patient beds at cottage hospitals in wigton , alston and maryport .
in patient beds have been unused at alston ( anyway in recent months because of staffing shortages .

local health officials say it has enabled them to test plans to provide nursing in the community instead , but the cumbria partnership trust , which runs the hospitals , says the beds will not be permanently closed until alternative plans have been agreed .
adequate alternative provision must be fully in place before any existing beds are closed or relocated . ''
author: Bob Cooper
Political reporter, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: four contest for penrith council seat
text: people in penrith are going to the polls today .
a by-election is being held to elect a councillor for penrith north on eden district council .
four candidates are standing and the polls close at 22:00 .

documents.title: alston schools come together for a cumbrian first
text: celebrations have been held in alston where england 's highest market town has welcomed a new era of education for the county .
author: News and Star
Newspaper

documents.title: mountain festival brings outdoor thousands into kendal
text: up to 20,000 people are expected to descend on kendal this weekend for the town 's annual mountain festival , adding millions of pounds to the economy .
this will be the first festival since the lake district was announced as a unesco world heritage site earlier this year .

organisers say they hope that will add to already increasing numbers of foreign visitors , with the festival attracting people from as far as the us and canada and delegates from china also arriving today .
the weekend of film , literature and outdoor activities will be officially opened at 17:30 by cumbrian mountaineer and patron sir chris bonington .
author: John Bowness
BBC Radio Cumbria reporter

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : colder and brighter
text: weather on the fell tops : colder and brighter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : rain at first , then brighter
text: it will be a cloudy and wet start to the day across cumbria , but quickly turning brighter from the west .
it will be a breezy day with highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: good morning : we 'll be posting the news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast , and other things that may catch our eye from around the county until about 18:00
you can get involved .
if there 's news you think we should know or you want to share a photo you 've taken in the county , let us know by sending an email , on facebook or on twitter .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter
